intro: Brossaea bracteata var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved brossaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed along its stems. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical or subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
